idea-plugin.name: Git Assume Unchanged
idea-plugin.description:
Easily manage Git's assume-unchanged flag directly from IntelliJ IDEA.

This plugin provides convenient actions to mark files as "assume-unchanged" or remove that flag, allowing you to tell Git to temporarily ignore changes to tracked files without modifying .gitignore.

Features

  • Mark single or multiple files as assume-unchanged
  • Remove assume-unchanged flag from files
  • Accessible via Git context menu
  • Automatic Git repository validation
  • Clear success/error notifications
  • Works with all JetBrains IDEs (IntelliJ IDEA, PyCharm, WebStorm, etc.)

Usage

  1. Right-click on any file(s) in the project view
  2. Navigate to Git â†’ Git Assume
  3. Choose Assume Unchanged or No Assume Unchanged

What is Assume Unchanged?

Git's assume-unchanged flag tells Git to ignore changes to a tracked file in your working directory. This is useful when you need to modify configuration files locally without committing the changes.
